definitions.definition: a group of twelve of the same thing
a group of approximately twelve people or things

examples.text: The company employs no more than **a couple of dozen** people.
Only about **half a dozen** people turned up.
There was only space for a **half-dozen** tables.
There were two dozen or so, men mostly, all looking a little bored.

definitions.definition: a lot of people or things

examples.text: I've been there dozens of times.
We interviewed **dozens and dozens** of people.
They arrived in dozens *(= in large numbers)*.
Babies are turning up in their dozens to be snapped for the paper's Baby of the Year competition.

definitions.definition: very common and therefore not valuable
used to say that there is not much real difference between two possible choices

examples.text: She was chatting away, nineteen to the dozen.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French dozeine, based on Latin duodecim ‘twelve’.
